author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
title: Fellow Officer Muddies Prosecution’s Case in New York Sergeant’s Murder Trial - WSJ
text:
The prosecution’s murder case against New York Police Department Sgt. Hugh Barry grew more complicated Friday with the eyewitness testimony of a fellow NYPD officer, who contradicted earlier witnesses on details of the 2016 death of a 66-year-old mentally ill Bronx woman.
Officer Michael Garces, who was called to testify by prosecutors, offered testimony in Bronx Supreme Court that differed from the prosecution’s previous witness testimonies. Earlier, two emergency medical technicians testified that one of the medics began...
